bullets.text: Shutdown deal prospects lift U.S. stock futures as Senate nears funding vote; widespread flight cancellations highlight economic disruption from air-traffic cutbacks.
Administration urges states to reverse full SNAP benefits, cutting aid for millions and potentially dampening consumer spending in low-income communities.
Trump floats $2,000 'tariff dividend' checks to most Americans, reframing tariff revenue as household transfers with uncertain inflation and trade impacts.
U.S. nuclear power revival advances, but long-term radioactive waste storage remains unresolved, constraining deployment timelines and financing.
Iran's unprecedented drought and Tehran water crisis raise risks of internal instability, regional tensions, and pressure on energy-intensive industries.
After Hurricane Melissa, distributed solar kept power on for some Jamaicans, demonstrating climate resilience and grid decentralization benefits.
Blue Origin scrubs New Glenn launch carrying NASA's ESCAPADE Mars mission; reliability questions linger ahead of November 12 retry.
Apple reportedly planning satellite-powered iPhone features, signaling deeper device-network integration that could disrupt carriers and emergency communications markets.
AI sector faces valuation wobble ahead of major industry gathering, tempering risk appetite after a 'buy everything' rally.
Montana enshrines a 'right to compute,' setting a state-level precedent for digital autonomy debates around AI, encryption, and software restrictions.
U.S. weighs restrictions on TP-Link, highlighting rising supply-chain security scrutiny of Chinese networking gear and potential consumer cost impacts.
Federal judge resigns warning of an 'existential threat' to democracy, underscoring institutional stress and potential policy volatility.
Evidence Antarctica's ice rapidly collapsed 9,000 years ago suggests higher near-term sea-level risk under continued warming.
Warm subsurface ocean on Saturn's moon Enceladus could be habitable, elevating targets for future life-detection missions.
New analyses suggest dark energy may be evolving over time, challenging standard cosmology and future precision-physics assumptions.
